originalText.text:
Recently planned a trip to Egypt.  Was advised to cancel when war broke out in the Middle east.  There is a level 3 travel warning from the state department for Egypt.
National Geographic would only refund part of the trip.  I was told I had to file a claim with the insurance company.
I did just that.  Was denied it all.
Took 2 months to hear back about the denial.
I would never use this company again

originalText.text:
I was unable to complete my travel plans due to a positive covid case. I submitted a claim on may 28th for the upcoming flight on the 31st and submitted all required documents. (after first set of documents they take 3.5 weeks to tell you they need MORE documents). It is now July 12th and I have not received any insight on the claim other than to “call back next week”, which is the same broken record response I’ve received for the past month and a half. I’ve been transferred to two different adjusters who are apparently in control of my claim - neither answer their phone or return voicemails.

Awful company that does not adhere to their own policies of a “10 day turnaround” on claim decisions.

originalText.text: My travel companion and I were unable to travel from the US to India due to complications following unexpected back surgery.  We completed the claim forms and spoke to an associate before we submitted the forms, a few weeks before our scheduled flights, to ensure the physician's letter was acceptable and we were told it was.  We faxed in the completed claim paperwork and 3 weeks later we received a horribly written email asking us for the physician to complete information on the claim form that was included in the letter.  We were also asked to submit our itinerary for our hotel after explaining we were staying with family.  Lastly, we were instructed to submit an invoice with details of our flights which we had submitted.  We even submitted copies of our credit card statements with our flight charges and partial refunds, which were also detailed on the invoice from our travel agent.  I requested a call back from a manager via email and by phone and was told I would receive a call within 2 business days.  I have NOT received a call.  We are beyond annoyed with Zurich's lack of response and misinformation. BEWARE, DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY FOR TRAVEL INSURANCE - THEY ARE UNPROFESSIONAL, SLOPPY AND THEY PROVIDE TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.   We will be pursuing other means of obtaining a response.

originalText.text:
The travel insurance is a scam.
I purchased travel insurance for a trip to from Miami to Egypt. The event I am traveling for was postponed. My travel insurance claim for the cost of adjusting dates was denied.

originalText.text: Site is extremely hard to navigate. I filed a loss claim and didn't get a response until 3 months later! They were asking for dated doctors documents, which are impossible to get now 3 months later. So I guess I won't be compensated due to them taking so long to respond.
